company: Brigham and Women's Hospital, Harvard Medical School
summary:
Working in the lab of [Prof. Yang-Yu Liu](https://yangyuliu.bwh.harvard.edu/), my research focuses on developing advanced computational methods for microbiome-targeted translational research. Key projects include: 
- Predicting metabolomic profiles through deep learning models 
- Creating predictive models suitable for precision nutrition 
- Leveraging metaproteome to understand functional redundancy 
- Advancing omics-based techniques for the diagnosis of diseases

Working with [Prof. Sergei Maslov](https://maslov.bioengineering.illinois.edu/), I focused on modeling the complex interactions within microbial communities to understand their ecological and evolutionary dynamics. My work included: 
- Exploring community assembly influenced by microbial cooperative interactions 
- Investigating predator-prey interactions between microbes and phages 
- Predicting metabolomic profiles using ecological models
